alert.note: Alert for Bartholomew; Decatur; Jackson; Jennings (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 8:51AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Decatur, southern Bartholomew, Jackson and Jennings Counties through 930 AM EDT... At 850 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Seymour, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Seymour around 855 AM EDT. North Vernon and Vernon around 910 AM EDT. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 37 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
